text: Ricardo Piglia (November 24, 1941 - January 6, 2017) was an Argentine one of the most famous contemporary writers in Argentina. He was born in Adrogu√© and raised in Mar del Plata. He was known for his fiction books Artificial Respiration (1980), The Absent City (1992), Burnt Money (1997); and criticism including Criticism and Fiction (1986), Brief Forms (1999) and The Last Reader (2005). Piglia died at 75 on January 6, 2017 in Buenos Aires, Argentina after suffering from amyotrophic lateral sclerosis for three years. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:2017 deaths Category:People from Mar del Plata Category:Argentine writers
